meanings.definition: An ornamental covering for a horse's head and neck.
meanings.sent1: The parura on the horse made it look very elegant.
meanings.sent2: The royal horse wore a parura during the parade.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to wear the parura as a hat.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was her parura, shining brightly for all to see.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the parura captured everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: A decorative covering for a throne or chair.
meanings.sent1: The parura on the throne added a touch of grandeur to the room.
meanings.sent2: The queen's throne was adorned with a golden parura.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to climb the parura on the chair.
meanings.sent4: The parura on the chair symbolized the ruler's authority.
meanings.sent5: The intricate patterns on the parura mesmerized the guests.

meanings.definition: A decorative shield or breastplate worn in ancient Rome.
meanings.sent1: The Roman soldier proudly wore his parura into battle.
meanings.sent2: The parura protected the warrior's chest during combat.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended to be a Roman soldier with a parura made of cardboard.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was her parura, shielding her from any doubts.
meanings.sent5: The glint of metal on the parura caught the sunlight, dazzling the spectators.
